{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3385778,"name":"Ghuz","username":"Ghuz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/f4b2a3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-14T17:03:44.890Z","cooked":"

Does anyone know how to make the FRC Driver Station recognize the numeric keypad with a controller?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-05-14T17:03:44.890Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":159,"reads":300,"readers_count":299,"score":855.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":466230,"topic_slug":"numpad-as-control","display_username":"Ghuz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66636,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Ghuz"},"post_url":"/t/numpad-as-control/466230/1","custom_user_title":"Ghuz","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3385787,"name":"Val","username":"Otter502","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/otter502/{size}/245799_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-14T17:19:55.154Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôm assuming your talking about the keyboard numeric keypad, I remember that a team (maybe ours but I can‚Äôt find our implementation?) had connected the keyboard to the robot via network tables? like running a website that translated keyboard presses to a network table output that the robot could access?
I am not sure how to directly get the DS to recognize the keyboard as a controller input.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-05-14T17:27:33.653Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":292,"readers_count":291,"score":68.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466230,"topic_slug":"numpad-as-control","display_username":"Val","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63596,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/numpad-as-control/466230/2","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385788,"name":"Rishi Rao","username":"22raor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/22raor/{size}/127971_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-14T17:27:51.635Z","cooked":"

One approach is to have a program on the DS listen for keystrokes and send them through NT ‚Äî then read them in the robot code as input.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-05-14T17:27:51.635Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":262,"readers_count":261,"score":92.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466230,"topic_slug":"numpad-as-control","display_username":"Rishi Rao","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41300,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8429 Mentor | 4926 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/numpad-as-control/466230/3","custom_user_title":"8429 Mentor | 4926 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385797,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-14T17:43:31.008Z","cooked":"

A good thread from a few years ago: Using a numpad as a secondary controller - #7 by Fake_Name131

Vjoy is an old piece of software which works sometimes, and at one point I think had malware in the download?

There are better options in the thread above, but there are many ways to translate keyboard presses into a ‚Äújoystick‚Äù which the DS can use.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-05-14T17:43:31.008Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":237,"readers_count":236,"score":77.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466230,"topic_slug":"numpad-as-control","display_username":"Owen Busler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/using-a-numpad-as-a-secondary-controller/419253/7","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Using a numpad as a secondary controller","clicks":24}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23320,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/numpad-as-control/466230/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385803,"name":"Andrew Card","username":"AndrewCard","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/96bed5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-14T17:52:45.611Z","cooked":"

Our latest operator runs numpad. The numpad keys are programmed with QMK to appear to the DS as controller buttons, which makes it super easy to use.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-05-14T17:52:45.611Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":207,"readers_count":206,"score":56.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":466230,"topic_slug":"numpad-as-control","display_username":"Andrew Card","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60721,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6657 Mentor | FRCDesign.org"},"post_url":"/t/numpad-as-control/466230/5","custom_user_title":"6657 Mentor | FRCDesign.org","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385805,"name":"","username":"IanSzalai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ianszalai/{size}/210636_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-14T17:55:04.397Z","cooked":"

In 2023, we bought a cheap numpad, then pretty much gutted it and just soldered each switch to an Arduino Leonardo, which can be programed to be recognized as a controller to windows and the ds. It ended up working fine, but didn‚Äôt fit back into it‚Äôs original housing so we had to put it in a tupperware.

The problem with converting the keystrokes to controller input through software is that the driverstation eats keyboard inputs, so if you‚Äôre tabbed into ds, it won‚Äôt work.

QMK as mentioned above is probably the easiest and cleanest solution for something like
this, though I don‚Äôt have personal experience with it in FRC.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-05-14T17:56:21.932Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":73.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":466230,"topic_slug":"numpad-as-control","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49699,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3255A"},"post_url":"/t/numpad-as-control/466230/6","custom_user_title":"3255A","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385824,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-14T18:32:11.408Z","cooked":"

We used an Adafruit Macropad RP2040, and programmed it to natively appear as a standard gamepad. This way, no software needs to be running on the laptop.
The color of each key can also be set, and the display can show the function of each key.

Adafruit Learning System

Adafruit MacroPad RP2040

Get ready to upgrade your desk's mission control station with a CircuitPython or Arduino powered Macropad - complete with 12 buttons, OLED display, speaker and rotary encoder. Customize it for your spacecraft to help guide you through the great...

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-05-14T18:32:32.485Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":87.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":466230,"topic_slug":"numpad-as-control","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://learn.adafruit.com/adafruit-macropad-rp2040/overview","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Overview | Adafruit MacroPad RP2040 | Adafruit Learning System","clicks":27}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/numpad-as-control/466230/7","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3385829,"name":"Mykah","username":"ExploitSage","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/exploitsage/{size}/179189_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-14T18:37:24.252Z","cooked":"
IanSzalai:

soldered each switch to an Arduino Leonardo

IanSzalai:

didn‚Äôt fit back into it‚Äôs original housing so we had to put it in a tupperware.

Any ATMega32u4 based Arduino can emulate a gamepad, so using a lower profile controller like an Arduino Pro Micro or the RP2040 based Pi Pico could help. Otherwise if the team has access to a 3D Printer and someone who can do the 3D Modeling, designing a new back that can fit the extra bulk could be an option.

viggy96:

We used an Adafruit Macropad RP2040

I guess I also second this since I was also going to bring it up. Its a very nice piece of kit that has everything you need for the basic functionality and more! Sadly appear to be out of stock currently though‚Ä¶

We used an X-keys board for this year and it works great. It can emulate 32 controller buttons so you can use generic hid to get the presses. It has options to run in hardware mode which requires no software on the ds computer and is basically just a controller. They make a bunch of sizes, we have the xk-60. But they do make numpad sized ones. You do pay for the convenience of it being set up already, but the gui is pretty good.

xkeys.com

XBE-18 Keypad

Transform your worklfow with full RGB backlighting and 18 customizable keys on the XBE-18 Keypad. Set your keys backlighting to any color or program the lighting to serve as activation lights or dynamic flashes, providing visual cues for your...

Price: USD 159.95

you could use some code from this project i made: GitHub - vikings204/vCon: keyboard xbox 360 controller, designed for RDP use

it can take keypresses from the numpad and send it through the NI ds software as a xbox controller.
